summary:
Seasoned IT professional with a positive look on life. 3 citizenships: BR; NL(EU); NZ(also Australia). 4 western European languages (PT, EN, ES, NL): 

Generalist professional with decades of experience in IT, Marketing, Business Intelligence across 3 continents. My training and experience allow me to translate marketing strategy to IT. Trained and experienced in: 'digital and direct marketing' and management of product; project; process; financial yield; customer value; IT; data. During the last 11 years I have served: marketing agencies; marketing departments of large Companies (Telcos, Banks); startups; and others with varied roles and skills in the following IT verticals: (1). business intelligence (DW/ETL/Data Science); (2). digital and direct marketing (NBA/RTD real time decisioning; omnichannel personalised orchestrated marketing); (3). web/online. With some exception made to some testing, I am a generalist qualified with both experience and training to play a variety of roles: advisor to directors/CXO; enterprise/domain/solution architect; customer intelligence/value/base manager/customer insights manager; marketing operations manager/lead; product manager/owner; business analyst/architect; technical project manager; team lead; senior developer; developer. In my early days I acquired solid computing skills at top world universities, specialising mostly in: software engineering (the whole lifecycle); capacity/performance; data-mining/AI/optimisation; architecture (BPM, EAI, SOA, blueprinting/roadmapping).

Certifications: CVM = Customer Value Management (Wharton University); Data Management (Dama Dmbok); Scrum product owner; Scrum master; Java architect; AWS practitioner; Java developer. Pega Certifications (5x omnichannel personalised marketing, processes): Postgraduate diplomed in direct/digital marketing; master in software architectures. 

Taught corporate training courses in the above areas.

Contact: aawcesta@yahoo.com

profile_positions.description: Insurance Sector Data Architect. Managing also the data-manager and data management function. Reporting to Analytics Director/CDO. Privacy by Design. Structured our Document/NLP data lake and tabular data lake. Delivered solutions for employee/customer-centric projects (single view of customer; single view of customer interactions; combined solution for experimentation+control-groups+A/B testing; data quality monitoring; processing clickstream/web-Analytics ourselves). Delivered policies/specifications/solutions for pseudonymization; anonymization; NLP document redaction/NER (named entity recognition).  Recommended anonymization solution for shared data pooling superior to single keyed hashing and less costly than zero-party computation. Alignment with DPO; security; risk; IT; Data Eng.; Data Sci. Defined data protection related processes such as access controls (DMBOK certified).  Prepared-for and responded-to audits.  Defined software lifecycle best practices, with regards to data, privacy. Evangelization.  Coordinated technical change across data-science and data engineering teams for FAIR data and serverless/microservice based architecture. Generated data models: conceptual; logical (data-vault; dimensional; data marts). Types of data marts: customer analytical records and other such as prospect analytical record; case analytical record; also in real-time.  Bridging architecture to development. Constructed simple marketing automation and next-best action systems (NBA) reusing Amazon AWS data infrastructure and Tealium activation (similar to AWS SES and AWS Pinpoint).  Elaboration of the processes/architecture for GDPR Consent Management/Privacy by design/Privacy management.  Procuring data catalogue. AI CRM ticket routing maximizing customer satisfaction and resolution time. Architecture and prototyping in AWS: Aurora Serverless; Redshift; SNS/SQS; Lambda functions; Step Functions; Sagemaker; CDK w/ Python CI/CD; Secret Manager; Dynamo; guardrails.
profile_positions.title: Data Architect; Manager

profile_positions.description:
Working with product owners and delivery management on simplified agile at scale trio (Spotify model). Providing engineering solutions to business problems. Objectives/goals: data-driven omnichannel marketing; customer-centricity; marketing relevance; personalisation; customer value management. Integrating various technologies: [1] Data warehouses/data lake (Databricks; Synapse); [2] near real-time customer-analytical-records (near-real-time =~ active data warehousing and customer analytical records =~ spine-tables; mining-tables; single views of the customer/subject) and NBA Next-best-action/closed-loop-marketing/decisioning (Pega Marketing); AI (Azure Machine Learning); [3] optimization/experimentation (e.g. Split IO, MMO or marketing mix optimization; control groups; universal experimentation w/ multiple systems seeing the same segments/splits); [4] Campaign management (Pega); [5] Web Analytics / Advertisement (Google analytics; Google Ads); [6] Paid Media Marketing (Salesforce Audience Studio; Pega Paid Media; Facebook & Google Ads-managers); [7] Portals; (Java, Javascript, Web Cache and Profiles in Cosmos DB; Graph QL); [8] Feedback tools (e.g. Usabilla); [9] Some architectures in Azure Event Streaming; other messaging or streaming systems (Kafka).

Architected data solutions in Azure using both UML and TOGAF/Aris/Archimate. Did a business process and functional decomposition of marketing/CDM (cusotmer data mgmt) bus. area. Coded extensively in Azure at home. Microsoft Azure trainings (Z900; DP200; etc). Read at least one book each for: Databricks; Azure ML; Synapse.  That goes on top of previous experience leading the construction of 3 data warehouses (in Oracle; PostgreSQL and some MS T-SQL); and Dama Dmbok data mgmt.

Architected for a combination of data lake and Synapse (DW). With ingestion resembling some aspects of data vault modelling (at least for the load_date; conformed business keys). Governance/privacy/pseudonymization/anonymization/policies.
profile_positions.title: Solutions Architect Relevance

profile_positions.location: Netherlands; Germany; Belgium; Switzerland; Europe; occasionaly World wide.
profile_positions.description:
2017, 2018, 2019: Dedicated to business analysis, requirements and training/coaching of staff at individual and group level (> 50% of the time). Drove the decisioning, customer value management; scientific data-driven marketing (control groups; champion and challenger; AB testing optimisations) first implementations of omnichannel real-time marketing for 4 Vodafone Opcos (in 2 as Pega.com badged consultant).   Including projects for learning from purchases as opposed to proposition accept or clicks. My care for Vodafone customer became evident to all  (I was myself Vodafone employee in its initial years from 2003 to 08).

2016, 2017 Managing; coaching; architecting and delivering Pega Marketing solutions for 2 insurance companies (2 companies).  

In the first insurance company (Achmea) contracted via Pega.com themselves as a Pega marketing project coach, Lead decisioning architect. The context of this coaching: (1). the only person experienced in Pega marketing in the project; (2). coaching and training a team of more than 10 people that are certified/but not experienced yet in Pega marketing (getting the experience now); (3). utilizing high-quality material I developed that complements the Pega training. (4). deliverables highly focused in personalisation, architected a personalised newsletter with each piece of news tailored and selected based on reader behaviour. (5). Trained business stakeholders on using creative proposition marketing. (6). Trained the data department on high value customer analytical records.

In the second insurance company (DEVK) we focused mostly on marketing automation.  Responsible for full planning of project activities to integrate Pega field marketing with external B2B insurance sales intermediaries and DialogWorks API for email marketing. After planning I led some development. 

On my spare time: applying LTSM deep neural nets and XGBoost to time series prediction.

See coaching example below:
profile_positions.title: Decisioning and Marketing Manager - Europe (at Smartrules, later acquired by First Technology)

profile_positions.location: Netherlands; Germany; Belgium; Switzerland; Europe; occasionaly World wide.
profile_positions.description:
2019 Lead Decisioning Archiect for Vodafone Portugal (using Pega 8.1 for data-driven NBA/Marketing). Starting the omnichannel programme with real-time triggered outbound campaigns for retention (part of "always-on" marketing programme). On a PegaSystems contract. At that time I was the only external doing Pega marketing. Presentations and trainings given on reporting capabilities within Pega marketing.

2018 LDA (lead decisioning architect) for the CVM (Customer Value Management) department from Vodafone Netherlands. Pega Marketing 7.3. Built the foundation for the "always-on" marketing programme. Contracted via Pega.com for customer. One of two external consultants in the project (my responsibility: Pega marketing; his responsibility: infra and cloud). Deliveries: (1). Presentations and training for building awareness of new ways of doing marketing for digital transformation; (2). green field building of omnichannel marketing platform infrastructure; (3). centre of excellence/best practices on regression testing; (4). training on extracting value from data by designing a good customer analytical record/spine table/mining table for the 360 view of the customer, together with effective use of the customer interaction history;  (5). consulting on several areas: journey management, multi-channel media neutral marketing, digital transformation and marketing + marketing operation processes. (6). Coaching of internal marketing staff; advising managers (more than 30 hours of presentations given on competitiveness; omnichannel marketing; experimental marketing/champion and challenger/control groups; migration from Unica outbound to Pega; CVM; etc).

profile_positions.description:
MerkleInc: largest independent data analytics, CRM & performance marketing agency in the US, Merkle. Largest independent CRM agency in Europe. Dentsu Aegis: 5th largest marketing group in the world.

Jul-Aug 2016: SDA, senior decisioning architect for an NBA, RTD (real time decisioning) project for HSBC bank Australia (working as Pega.com staff and joint with the largest Pega partner). Responsible for business analysis and implementation of prioritisation strategies; responsible for design and implementation of: validity/eligibility; contact and treatment; real time adaptive models for both propositions and the choice of their treatments. Pega marketing 7.2. Omni-channel.

Project: creating a Java web front-end for geofencing marketing targeting (define campaign and its geofence). Team: ~3 Java; basic Spring developers. Customer: our director and SAS.com itself (2 director level stakeholders). Methodology: scrum/agile.  Delivery platform: Amazon AWS EC2 and S3.

Mar-Jun 2016: Finishing my marketing diploma; doing thought leadership; writing business process for our line of work; certifying as Pega SDA; preparing for other certifications.
profile_positions.title: Senior Decisioning Architect Consultant - SDA; Product Owner

profile_positions.location: Based in London and Barcelona; working worldwide.
profile_positions.company: Comet Global Consulting - Acquired by MerkleInc.com
profile_positions.description:
Aug15-Mar2016: Pega Senior Decisioning Architect/Consultant. End-to-end role responsible for: business analysis; architecture; design and implementation of most of the marketing decisioning strategies: retention; omnichannel (centralised decisioning inbound+outbound marketing automation); customer value management/CVM retention calculators; contact and treatment frameworks; product compatibility; offer compatibility; etc. Customer is Wind Telecom in Milan, subsidiary of Vimpelcom the 6th largest Telco group. The project was a greenfield NBA project. Reporting to Pega Technical Director. Project joint with another large Pega partner. Software: Pega 7.1.12, mostly strategy designer.

Jan14-Aug15: Pega SDA Senior Decisioning Consultant. part Merkle's team doing Pega centralised decisioning/next best action marketing at two Scottish banks and one UK telecom.  For the two Scottish banks I joined the Mobile-First B project for Clydesdale and Yorkshire Banks (https://mobilemarketingmagazine.com/mobile-first-b-takes-flight-clydesdale-yorkshire-banks); reporting to diverse team leads on a project joint with one of the largest Pega partners.  For the British Telecom, I looked business analysis for a project to allow tablet point of sale decisioning with artificial intelligence to support the work of telecom physical shop staff (e.g. recommend on tablet screen the best mobile and price plans based on AI).

Nov13-Nov14: Product owner / Scrum master coach on project using SAS IA (SAS intelligent advertising; AIMatch.com). Software created: a self service digital marketing agency front-end to SAS IA/AIMatch using: Java/JEE (Restful; JAXB, JSON, Knockout.js, AJAX, XSLT); deployed to Amazon Cloud/AWS with EC3; Beanstalk. Led three people in my team. Reporting to SAS.com.

Sep13-Nov13: Digital/Direct Marketing+IT Consultant in international projects (weve.com, monitise.com) involving BI, Web and Performance applied to direct marketing and online advertisement.
profile_positions.title: Senior Decisioning Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Palmen & Cesta (my own consulting company). Offered software services in architecture; BI and ITIL capacity management; AI; web. Training in capacity management.

(1) eldorado.org.br: creating an Oracle data warehouse system for Dell.com. Managed 20 people. Responsible for the product backlog (~product owner); 

(2) http://www.bmfbovespa.com.br , São Paulo Stock Exchange, teaching and applying artificial intelligence predictive models for computer systems performance; consultant/coach; project lead (5 people team, designed my first MOLAP cube, had used and architected around cubes before for Vodafone); data-warehouse architect/data model designer for computer systems performance data.  Also at Eldorado.org.br and Dell.com: using neural networks and regression models to size machines sold by Dell.com  (models built in GNU-R and Java Encog; see publications).

(3) leading the creation of whole data warehouses in Oracle for Dell.com and in PostgreSQL for online advertisement data for a spin-off from Dentsu-Aegis (large >2mi projects); Led 5 people. Technologies: Bash; PL/pgSQL.

(4) architecting, designing and building/developing modules for the online advertisement / affiliate marketing platform from M4N.nl (now part of http://www.zanox.com). Languages/technologies used: Java; spring; log4; git; XML; SQL; PostgreSQL.

(5) Surveying 'cloud-based online website/webservices'​ stress and load testing tools for: http://www.tigerline.ag/ . Stress/performance testing of websites.

(6). Publishing 5 articles in 2 years for Eldorado Research institute (see publications).  My research projects used mostly data science applied to hardware performance optimisation; data visualisation problems.  Tools and Methods:  used mostly GNU-R; and Java. Used some very interesting Java libraries such as Mason (discrete simulation for anything, including customers behaviour); ECJ (Evolutionary computing in Java; genetic algorithms); Encog (Neural nets; Bayesian methods; SVM in Java).
profile_positions.title: Provider of software services - Owner & Consultant, Scrum Master, Project Manager, Lead, Coach

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the Business intelligence and CRM domains, but also some of the integration and web domain (including Telecom online advertisement related projects). Lead architect for NBA projects (next best action); trade profit calculator; and many others in the above mentioned areas.  Stakeholder for multiple projects at a time; reviewing project start documents; reviewing all project business cases in my area for IT impact; facilitating/co-creating and approving: requirements, architecture,design and implementations for processes and software (including data).

Sparkx enterprise architect; ARIS; TOGAF; eTOM; DFDs (data flow diagramming); BPMn/process diagramming; Entity-Relationship diagramming for dimensional modelling (star-schema) and also cubes.

Improving the reference architecture for business/marketing data marts and model management.

Lead architect representing Vodafone Netherlands on the RFI/RFP process to purchase a marketing automation tool. We purchased Chordiant - which later became Pega marketing - and run 3 projects on this platform. One of our projects was a trade profit calculator, or price optimizer using artificial intelligence (it would recommend price-plans/mobiles and decide among alternative offers with different discount-levels by estimating the expected value of propensity to accept at each price point * margin contribution at that price point).
profile_positions.title: General IT Domain Architect, Member of the Enterprise Architecture Team

profile_positions.description: Responsible for projects on web; CRM (including NBA, trade profit calculator); BI and integration areas mainly.  Tasks: data architecture; software architecture; entrerprise architecture; roadmapping; year planning.  Responsible for following multiple projects at a time; RFPs/RFIs;  assessing quality of system integrator staff before deployment;  requirements gathering; writing non-functional requirements; writing PSAs (project start architectures); steering and approving HLDs (high-level designs); LLDs (low-level designs) from system integrators; etc.  My department of 5 people serviced the whole company of 3000 people; and reported to the CTO.  Most of my projects were with the marketing department as main owner/stakeholder.
